attribute.name: name
attribute.label: Name
attribute.descr: The name for the field. Field names should consist of alphanumeric or underscore characters only and not start with a digit. This is not currently strictly enforced, but other field names will not have first class support from all components and back compatibility is not guaranteed. Names with both leading and trailing underscores (e.g. _version_) are reserved.

attribute.name: type
attribute.label: Type
attribute.descr: The name of a field type.

attribute.name: indexed
attribute.label: Indexed
attribute.descr: True if this field should be indexed. If (and only if) a field is indexed, then it is searchable, sortable, and facetable.

attribute.name: stored
attribute.label: Stored
attribute.descr: True if this field should be retrievable during a search.

attribute.name: multiValued
attribute.label: Multi valued
attribute.descr: True if this field may contain multiple values per document, i.e. if it can appear multiple times in a document.

attribute.name: omitNorms
attribute.label: Omit norms
attribute.descr: (Expert) set to true to omit the norms associated with this field (this disables length normalization and index-time boosting for the field, and saves some memory). Only full-text fields or fields that need an index-time boost need norms. Norms are omitted for primitive (non-analyzed) types by default.

attribute.name: omitTermFreqAndPositions
attribute.label: Omit term freq and positions
attribute.descr: If set, omit term freq, positions and payloads from postings for this field.

attribute.name: omitPositions
attribute.label: Omit positions
attribute.descr: If set, omits positions, but keeps term frequencies.

attribute.name: termVectors
attribute.descr: Set to true to store the term vector for a given field. When using MoreLikeThis, fields used for similarity should be stored for best performance.

attribute.name: termPositions
attribute.label: Term positions
attribute.descr: Store position information with the term vector. This will increase storage costs.

attribute.name: termOffsets
attribute.label: Term off sets
attribute.descr: Store offset information with the term vector. This will increase storage costs.

attribute.name: required
attribute.label: Required
attribute.descr: The field is required. It will throw an error if the value does not exist.

attribute.name: default
attribute.label: Default value
attribute.descr: A value that should be used if no value is specified when adding a document.

attribute.name: sortMissingLast
attribute.label: Sort missing last
attribute.descr: SortMissingLast and sortMissingFirst attributes are optional attributes are currently supported on types that are sorted internally as strings and on numeric types. This includes "string","boolean", and, as of 3.5 (and 4.x), int, float, long, date, double, including the "Trie" variants. If sortMissingLast="true", then a sort on this field will cause documents without the field to come after documents with the field, regardless of the requested sort order (asc or desc). If sortMissingLast="false" and sortMissingFirst="false" (the default), then default lucene sorting will be used which places docs without the field first in an ascending sort and last in a descending sort.

attribute.name: sortMissingFirst
attribute.label: Sort missing first
attribute.descr: If sortMissingFirst="true", then a sort on this field will cause documents without the field to come before documents with the field, regardless of the requested sort order.

copyField.descr: Any number of "copy field" declarations can be included in your schema, to instruct Solr that you want it to duplicate any data it sees in the "source" field of documents that are added to the index, in the "dest" field of that document. You are responsible for ensuring that the datatypes of the fields are compatible. The original text is sent from the "source" field to the "dest" field, before any configured analyzers for the originating or destination field are invoked. This is provided as a convenient way to ensure that data is put into several fields, without needing to include the data in the update command multiple times. The copy is done at the stream source level and no copy feeds into another copy. The maxChars property may be used in a copyField declaration. This simply limits the number of characters copied. A common requirement is to copy or merge all input fields into a single solr field. To do this the value of source attribute must be "*".

uniqueKey.label: Unique Key
uniqueKey.descr: The "unique key" declaration can be used to inform Solr that there is a field in your index which should be unique for all documents. If a document is added that contains the same value for this field as an existing document, the old document will be deleted. It is not mandatory for a schema to have a uniqueKey field, but an overwhelming majority of them do. It shouldn't matter whether you rename this to something else (and change the "unique key" value), but occasionally it has in the past. We recommend that you just leave this definition alone.

attribute.name: class
attribute.label: Class
attribute.descr: Specifying the class name of an Analyzer — anything extending org.apache.lucene.analysis.Analyzer.
attribute.value: An Analyzer that uses WhitespaceTokenizer. A WhitespaceTokenizer is a tokenizer that divides text at whitespace.
